comment.author: 10786632@N02
comment._content: If his hair was cut short for his life mask, as mentioned above, he probably kept it longer because it may have been coarse and wiry and he didn't want it to look like this.  Hair like this will lay flatter when it is longer.  Or it could be that he was trying something different.

comment.author: 12068800@N00
comment._content: Here's a quick animated GIF that gives you an idea of the stereoscopic effect. (time passes) ...Well, I didn't go to bed after all but instead made a reverse stereographic image that you can see by crossing your eyes. (next morning) Here's a "3D," red-and-blue, anaglyph of the same image.

comment.author: 58425275@N00
comment._content: Mr. Lincoln had Marfan Syndrome, as did his descendants, one feature of which is abnormal auricles (external ears).  He had many other features of Marfan Syndrome as well.  I was fascinated to learn from links on Kottke.org that Mr. Lincoln had a skull fracture of his forehead at age 10 as a result of a horse's kick, and he survived.  What an amazing person!
